definition: to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

sentences.english: It also forced France's express train operator to cut about half of its services.
sentences.chinese: 罢工还迫使法国的高速铁路把车次减半。

sentences.english: The increase to total collimator thickness also halves secondary collimator transmission.
sentences.chinese: 总准直器厚度的增加也减半了次级准直器的射线传输。

sentences.english: The first thing I have to do is bust that in half.
The new Office software production enterprises can enjoy the former two-year income tax exemptions and later six- year halve.
sentences.chinese: 新办软件生产企业享受企业所得税两免三减半的优惠。

sentences.english: Itamin tablets were also found to be highly beneficial, haling the risk of miscarriage.
sentences.chinese: 研究还发现维生素片也很有好处，能让流产风险减半。

sentences.english: Already, as the World Food Program's stocks were running low, rations had been halved.
sentences.chinese: 世界粮食计画库存渐少，粮食配给早已开始减半。

sentences.english: Solitary redoubles griefs, and cuts joys in halves.
sentences.chinese: 孤独使忧伤加倍，使欢乐减半。

sentences.english: When I started running outside I halved the usefulness of the gym.
sentences.chinese: 当我开始在室外跑步时，健身房的功效就减半了。

sentences.english: Friendship redoubles joys, and cuts grieves in halves.
sentences.chinese: 友情倍增我们的喜悦，减半我们的悲伤。

sentences.english: This number can halve later in life.
sentences.chinese: 这个数字在生命后期会减半。

sentences.english: They retrenched by eliminating half the workers.
sentences.chinese: 他们把人员减半以减少支出。

sentences.english: But if you meet it promptly and without flinching, you will reduce the danger by half.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果立即面对它毫不退缩，危险便会减半。

sentences.english: You found that halving your salary cut your enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 你发现，薪水减半降低了你的工作热情。

sentences.english: Whatever he watches now, cut that time in half.
sentences.chinese: 不管他现在看什么，让他把时间减半。

sentences.english: The meteor that thrusts in with needle bill.
sentences.chinese: 真减半的鸟嘴如流星般挤进来。

definition: to reduce or waive (taxes, punishment, rent, tuition etc)
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish
to increase by degrees/in increasing order/incremental/progressive
